intro: Erythrocephalum jeffreyanum, commonly known as the Jeffrey's erythranthemum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
